upset.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened
upset.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She was deeply upset about the way her father treated her.
Debbie was upset that he didn’t spend more time with her.
upset.translation[0].note_box[0].section: upset
unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened
Miss Hurley is too upset to speak to anyone at the moment.
She’s still deeply upset about her uncle’s death.
He’s upset that he didn’t get an invitation to their wedding.
hurt
upset and shocked because someone has been unkind to you, especially someone that you trusted and thought was a friend
Bill felt deeply hurt when he realized she had lied to him.
Gretta was really hurt that none of her friends came to visit her in the hospital.
Jackson was said to be ‘deeply hurt’ by the newspaper reports about him.
He had a hurt expression on his face.
distressed
very upset
Priests have been counselling distressed relatives of the victims.
She was visibly distressed after hearing of her husband’s accident.
Matilda was too distressed to speak.
distraught
so upset and worried that you are unable to do normal things, and nothing can make you feel calm
Benson was so distraught over the breakup of his marriage that he felt like committing suicide.
The distraught parents of the missing baby have made a public appeal for her return.
in a (terrible) state
so upset that you cannot stop crying
She called me one night in a terrible state, saying she wanted to die.
I could see that she was in a bit of a state.
be worked up
to be very upset or angry, so that you think things are worse than they really are
I was too worked up to sleep.
It’s not worth getting worked up about. Anyone can make a mistake.
upset.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
upset.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Don’t do anything that would upset him.
It upsets me to see you cry.
upset.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to change a plan or situation in a way that causes problems
upset.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The chemicals upset the balance of the environment.
upset.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to push something over without intending to
upset.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: He upset a bowl of soup.
upset.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to defeat an opponent who is considered to be much better than you
upset.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: worry and unhappiness caused by an unexpected problem
upset.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: If you are the victim of a burglary, the emotional upset can affect you for a long time.
upset.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: when a person or team defeats an opponent who is considered to be much better than them
upset.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: There was a major upset when the young skater took the gold medal.
